newsitem.title: USA: McAfee names Zach Nelson, former Oracle exec, as VP.
newsitem.headline: McAfee names Zach Nelson, former Oracle exec, as VP.

text.p: McAfee Associates Inc. said Monday it hired Zach Nelson, former Oracle Corp. vice president of marketing, as the head of its network management software business.
Nelson, 35, will oversee McAfee's development of help-desk and network management software, the company said. He also will help with McAfee's marketing efforts.
Nelson headed the marketing operations of Oracle, the second-biggest software company after Microsoft Corp. He worked at Oracle for four years.
"Primarily it was the job opportunity to move from a marketing role to a managerial role," Nelson said. "It was time for me to broaden my horizons."
Nelson said he left on amicable terms with Oracle "without burning any bridges."
Bill Larson, McAfee's president, said Nelson's expertise will be helpful as McAfee enters its next phase of growth.

McAfee, based in Santa Clara, Calif., is best-known for its free virus detection software. In recent years, the company has used its brand recognition among computer technicians to enter more lucrative software market segments, including network management.
